definition: To feel physically ill or unwell, often with symptoms like nausea, fever, or dizziness that indicate a health problem.
A small pocket of fluid that forms on the skin due to friction, burning, or infection, often found on feet or hands.
A sudden and forceful expulsion of air from the lungs, usually to clear the throat or airways of irritants or mucus.
A sensation of spinning or losing one's balance, often caused by problems in the inner ear or low blood pressure.
A contagious viral illness with symptoms like fever, sore throat, cough, and body aches that can leave a person feeling very weak.
The act of forcefully expelling the contents of the stomach through the mouth, usually due to illness or digestive issues.
An area of irritated or swollen skin that appears red, bumpy, or itchy, often caused by allergies, illness, or irritation.
A painful redness and inflammation of the skin caused by overexposure to ultraviolet (UV) rays from the sun.
Pain or irritation in the throat that often worsens when swallowing, usually caused by infection or dryness.
Pain or discomfort in the abdominal area, often caused by indigestion, gas, or a viral infection.
